alert.note: Alert for Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 16 at 12:41PM CST until February 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical fire conditions continue across portions of the Rio Grande Plains and southern Edwards Plateau early this afternoon... Gusty north to northwest winds continue early this afternoon behind last night`s cold front. Relative humidities have fallen into the upper teens and lower 20s along the Rio Grande, and are expected to spread further east into the warning area as surface heating continues this afternoon. Given these trends, as well as recent wind forecasts suggesting that sustained 15-20 MPH values will continue through early evening, the Red Flag Warning has thus been extended until 6 PM CST today. Individuals continue to be encouraged to avoid any activities that could inadvertently lead to the ignition and spread of wildfires through the early evening hours. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE RIO GRANDE PLAINS AND SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU... * WINDS...North 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala
